graph2D

Class Plotter

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.event.WindowAdapter
      • graph2D.Graph2D
        • graph2D.Plotter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.WindowFocusListener, java.awt.event.WindowListener, java.awt.event.WindowStateListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class Plotter
extends Graph2D
    Plotter lets users work with a graphic space for drawing as in a Plotter, following a, so called, "Turtle Geometry".
    Version:
    (1.2)
    Author:
    (CC-BY-NC-SA. IIP, PRG, EDA @ ETSINF-UPV. pmarques)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Plotter

        public Plotter(double mX,
               double xX,
               double mY,
               double xY)
        Creates a Plotter surface with real dimensions and default window dimensions, background color and title.
        Parameters:
        mX: - double. Minimum x-coordinate value, mX < xX.
        xX: - double. Maximum x-coordinate value, mX < xX.
        mY: - double. Minimum y-coordinate value, mY < xY.
        xY: - double. Maximum y-coordinate value, mY < xY.

    • Method Detail

      • forward

        public void forward(double l)
        Moves forward the drawing element. A line will be drawn if down is true. Negative values implies backward movements.

      • penDown

        public void penDown()
        Pen down.

      • penUp

        public void penUp()
        Pen up.

      • rotate

        public void rotate(double alfa)
        Increment the drawing element angle in alfa degrees. Is counter clockwise, so negative values represent clockwise angles.

      • setAngle

        public void setAngle(double alfa)
        Set the angle for the drawing element. Counter-clockwise

      • setPos

        public void setPos(double x,
                   double y)
        Set the drawing element position.
